sections.heading: Why A/B Testing Matters
sections.body: Every brand has different audiences, and small differences in visuals can dramatically impact performance. A/B testing allows you to compare variations and choose the best-performing creative.

sections.heading: The Elements You Should Test
sections.body:
Lighting style. Warm vs cool vs daylight.

Camera angle. POV vs flat-lay vs product focus.

Background type. Clean vs textured vs lifestyle.

Props. More props vs minimal.
sections.imagePrompt: A/B scene comparison of a product with warm vs cool lighting. 1:1.
sections.imageAlt: Two lighting variations for A/B testing.

sections.heading: Why AI Makes Testing Easier
sections.body: AI lets you generate multiple variations instantly. Instead of waiting for reshoots, you can tweak angles, backgrounds, and lighting in seconds.
sections.imagePrompt: Product photographed from different angles with similar backgrounds for variation testing. 1:1.
sections.imageAlt: Different angle variations of the same product.

sections.heading: Best Practices
sections.body:
• Test one variable at a time.
  • Start with 3 variations.
  • Use consistent metrics.
  • Keep brand identity consistent.

sections.heading: Final Takeaway
sections.body: A/B testing with AI UGC helps you quickly identify what your audience responds to, giving your ads and product pages a measurable conversion lift.
